H0.text: Helicase opens two strands of DNA.

H1.text: Replication opens two strands of DNA.

H2.text: Adenylate is the molecule that opens two strands of DNA.

H3.text: Chromosomes are the structures that open two strands of DNA.

A4.text: Helicases are often used to separate strands of a DNA double helix or a self-annealed RNA molecule using the energy from ATP hydrolysis

A5.text: Once the helicase and ATP are bound, local strand separation occurs, which requires binding of ATP but not the actual process of ATP hydrolysis
